Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of Amazon to right (upper body, most of head, and left arm outstretched with shield in inside view remaining; wearing a necklace and hair tied back with added red band; black band at the neck and sleeve of her red tunic; added white flesh; shield band decorated with crosses; porpax with large X; Xs also around rim of shield; four sets of thongs); at right, shield of opponent seen from outside (faded white cockerel as device, to left; around perimeter, fasteners indicated by crosses).
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.1241, which replicates the female, as far as is preserved. See also von Bothmer, D., Amazons in Greek Art. Oxford 1957, 11, no. 56 and pl. 26, no. 1.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 266, no. B195)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0139) (Phase 1)
